Author: etherealaqua
Text: I think the ONLY situation where this would be possible is if you have ONLY BED with no history of restricting or purging in any form whatsoever (fasting, exercise, anything) and are severely overweight/obese and your treatment team of qualified professionals agree you need to lose weight for your health. Even then, the main focus shouldn’t be losing weight, it should be recovering mentally. Even if you’re in this situation but your main goal is simply to lose weight rather than actually recover from your disorder, then it’s still not possible. I think a focus on weight loss is ALWAYS going to be contradictory to real recovery.

Author: livipup
Text: I think you can become healthy physically, but if you want to lose weight there will always be a greater likelihood of relapsing. Even if you just want to maintain your weight it can be a problem. Ideally you would simply want to stay within a healthy range without worrying if it's a high or low weight in that range.
